name: English Country Garden B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Rose Cottage & it exceeded out expectations. Wonderful experience & beautiful setting. Dinner & breakfast were delicious. We wished we allowed ourselves time to stay a few more days. A great place to unwind & feel pampered.
reviews.title: Wish we had more nites here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the russian room for our honeymoon and it was incredibly spacious and beautiful. We also had dinner there one night and it was amazing. From the appetizer to dessert, we wanted to eat more but were completely stuffed. For a B&B, they had small tables for meals, so couples got to eat by themselves and not have to socialize with others. The wireless worked well only in the living room/common area so trying to use it in the russian room (at the end of the hallway) was spotty at best. Just a note in case you care about this.
reviews.title: A peaceful and secluded retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful and feature flower gardens, lawns, forest, and a lake which is home to beavers and apparently also a moose. A canoe is available for guests to take out on the lake.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Russian Room was spotless and spacious and the themed decor was interesting. The bathroom was very luxurious with a jetted tub. The room includes a sitting area with large glass patio doors with a view out to the lake and satellite tv.
reviews.title: Top notch personal service in a relaxing private setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I did a roadtrip around Nova Scotia in late April and needed a place to stay after our day exploring the Highlands National Park. The English Country Garden was the perfect choice. It's set on a peaceful property right on the lake. We stayed in the African room, which was beautifully decorated, spacious and had a nice soaker tub in the bathroom. However, if you're willing to spend the money, I'd recommend the Russian Room, which looks amazing! We also booked dinner for that evening as the B&B runs a little restaurant there as well. Wow, what a fabulous dinner! I highly recommend making dinner
reviews.title: Perfect Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made reservations at ECG for but one night, mainly to break up a long day's drive, and that turned out to be a mistake. Had we known then what we do now, we would have booked all of our stay in Cape Breton with Penny & Co. and made day trips to Pleasant Bay, Baddeck, Louisburg, etc. from there.
reviews.title: Their website and road signs promised QUALITY. THEY DID NOT LIE.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our one-night stand was indeed an experience to be treasured. We were in the African Room, a large room with ample space and facilities. The room was exquisitely decorated and with extensive bathroom supplies.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this is your first visit to Cape Breton, you are going to love it. We were there only three days and we saw hummingbirds, bear, moose, whales, bald eagles, fox and countless wildflowers.
reviews.title: Cape Breton is Amazing !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our honeymoon was meeting Katy who serves breakfast, cleans rooms and serves dinner if you stay there. She will highlight a map for you and tell you where to go. We did everything she said to do and had an unforgettable honeymoon.
reviews.title: Number #1 B & B in Cape Bretoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place : The inn is charming, spotless and well kept. There are three rooms in the main house and one separate cabin. We stayed in the russian room which was quite spacious, nice bathroom. Immaculate ! The bed was not comfortable, it was a king, and you both will roll into the center because it sags.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — Towels - clean but were thin and lower quality

reviews.text: The Location : The Inn is about an hour from the beginning of the Cabot Trail in the National Park so it is a bit of a trek every day to get to the park. It depends on what your plans are. If you want to go hiking every day, we would stay closer to the park in Cheticamp or Ingonish.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Breakfast : Very tasty ! Large portions ! Worth Waking up for.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

aka: English Country Garden B&B Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia - Indian Brook
description: Relax with us and experience the art of living. Overlooking a tranquil lake, our inspired rooms are the beginning of a Bed & Breakfast experience like few other. 5 Luxury Suites with 4 piece bathroom en-suites. Full English Breakfast. Open Year-Round. No Stairs for most of our suites. Fine Dining by advance reservation only. Canoe and hiking trails. Professional Innkeepers.
